sen.j: 高梨 高信（たかなし たかのぶ）は、平安時代末期の武士。
sen.e: Takanobu TAKANASHI was a samurai in the late Heian period.
Takanobu TAKANASHI was a samurai lived in the late Heian period.
Takanobu TAKANASHI was a samurai lived in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 高梨氏は清和源氏井上氏頼季流の一族で、平安時代中期に信濃国北部に栄えた土豪である。
sen.e: The Takanashi clan, a family descended from Yorisue INOUE of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan), was a local clan once prosperous in the North of Shinano Province in the mid Heian period.

The Takanashi family having a blood relation with Yorisue INOUE of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan) was a local powerful family enjoying prosperity in the northern part of Shinano Province in the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: 「高梨氏」は井上頼季の血縁という内容なのでclanではなくfamilyに変更しました。文献によると井上頼季の子孫ではなく、結婚による同族と考えられるのでdescendを訂正しました。北部の表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: The Takanashi family having a blood relation with Yorisue INOUE of the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan) was a local powerful family enjoying prosperity in the northern part of Shinano Province in the mid Heian period.

sen.j: 源平合戦において従兄弟である高梨忠直らと共に、源義仲傘下に入る。
sen.e: At Genpei War, he, together with his cousin, Tadanao TAKANASHI, and others, came under the umbrella of MINAMOTO no Yoshinakathe.
When the Genpei War broke out, he became a follower of MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka together with his cousin, Tadanao TAKANASHI and others.
sen.cmt: 源義仲にスペルミスがありましたので修正しました。多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: When the Genpei War broke out, he became a follower of MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka together with his cousin, Tadanao TAKANASHI and others.

sen.j: これは中原氏を介した婚姻関係から来るもので、当時は女系血縁が比較的重要であったことがわかる。
sen.e: It was based on marital relations through the Nakahara clan, suggesting that the blood relation of the maternal side of a family was relatively important at that time.

His decision to take MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka's side resulted from the marital relationship with the Nakahara family, which suggests that the blood relation of the maternal line was regarded as relatively important at that time.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので言葉を補い書き換えました。
sen.e: His decision to take MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka's side resulted from the marital relationship with the Nakahara family, which suggests that the blood relation of the maternal line was regarded as relatively important at that time.

sen.j: 越後の城資茂率いる平家方の軍を破るなど戦功を挙げた。
sen.e: Although he distinguished himself in the war by defeating the army of the Taira family side led by JO no Sukemochi of Echigo, he fought at the Bicchuthe Battle of Mizushima against TAIRA no Shigehira, TAIRA no Noritsune, TAIRA no Tomomori, and so forth and was defeated to death.
He rendered distinguished services in the war: for example, he defeated the army belonging to the Taira clan commanded by JO no Sukemochi of Echigo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。多少わかりづらいので言葉を補い書き換えました。
sen.e: He rendered distinguished services in the war: for example, he defeated the army belonging to the Taira clan commanded by JO no Sukemochi of Echigo.

sen.j: が、備中水島の戦いで平重衡・平教経・平知盛らと戦って敗死した。
sen.e: He fought against TAIRA no Shigehira, TAIRA no Noritsune, TAIRA no Tomomori and so forth in the battle broke out in Bicchu-Mizushima, however, he was defeated and killed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He fought against TAIRA no Shigehira, TAIRA no Noritsune, TAIRA no Tomomori and so forth in the battle broke out in Bicchu-Mizushima, however, he was defeated and killed.

sen.j: この戦で足利義清や外戚の海野幸広も討たれている。
sen.e: At this battle, Yoshikiyo ASHIKAGA, and Yukihiro UNNO, his maternal relative, were also suppressed.
Yoshikiyo ASHIKAGA, and Takanobu's maternal relative Yukihiro UNNO were also killed in the battle.
sen.cmt: 「討たれる」は「戦死する」の意味と解釈して書き換えました。前置詞"at"を削除しました。
sen.e: Yoshikiyo ASHIKAGA, and Takanobu's maternal relative Yukihiro UNNO were also killed in the battle.

sen.j: なお、同輩の高梨忠直は京都の六条河原で刑死した。
sen.e: Incidentally, Tadanao TAKANASHI, his comrade, was executed at Rokujo-gawara, Kyoto City.
Meanwhile, his colleague Tadanao TAKANASHI was executed at Rokujo-gawara, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 「なお」は一方の意味と考え、"Incidentally"を"Meanwhile"に修正しました。「同輩」は"comrade"と若干ニュアンスが異なるのではないかと考え"colleague"に換えました。
sen.e: Meanwhile, his colleague Tadanao TAKANASHI was executed at Rokujo-gawara, Kyoto City.
